results.title: A Call to Preventive Action to Support Caregivers
results.description: One key element to ensuring that a caregiver has the information and access to support is an actively engaged health care provider - either the caregiver's health care provider or the provider for the person receiving care. The authors of this essay recommend that it be both.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Differences in Race and Health of Prostate Cancer Survivors
results.description: In a study of prostate cancer survivors, researchers found that more white prostate cancer survivors reported drinking alcohol and receiving a pneumococcal vaccination than black survivors, and more black survivors reported being obese than white survivors.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Trends for Cross-Sector Collaboration on School Nutrition and PE
results.description: This study describes secular trends in collaboration between state agency staff responsible for school nutrition and physical education activities and other organizations from 2000 to 2012.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Independent Children More Likely to Better Manage Diseases in Adulthood
results.description: Young people who feel they can control their chronic illnesses without adult assistance are more likely to learn the self-management skills needed for disease control later in life, researchers find.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Moving for Better Balance
results.description: Researchers recruited rural faith-based organizations in West Virginia to implement tai chi exercise programs in an effort to offer fall prevention exercises to older adults in the community.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Optimizing Stroke Prevention in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation
results.description: Researchers find that computerized antithrombotic risk assessment tool for atrial fibrillation patients has a minimal impact on actual treatment.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Simple Water Station Setup Increases Students' Water Consumption
results.description: Providing water dispensers with cups in school cafeterias and promoting their use led to a nearly 20 percent increase in the number of California students who drank water at lunchtime compared with school cafeterias with only traditional drinking fountains.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Immigrant Worker Health Interventions
results.description: Researchers used social network analysis to describe interagency structure needed to design and deliver a comprehensive community-based chronic disease prevention program for immigrant workers.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Physical Activity, Weight Management Among Bangladeshis in NYC
results.description: Researchers explored the contextual factors affecting physical activity patterns and weight management in the Bangladeshi community of New York City.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Legal Preemption and the Prevention of Chronic Conditions
results.description: The objective of this article is to unravel the legal concept of preemption, explain its use as a tool to both thwart or further public health interventions, and offer practical guidance for how to legally navigate around it to address factors underlying chronic conditions.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Opportunities for Increased Physical Activity in the Workplace
results.description: The objective of this pilot study was to examine the implementation, feasibility, and acceptability of using a Walking Meeting protocol to increase the level of work-related physical activity among a group of sedentary white-collar workers.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: The Unfulfilled Promise of Pay-for-Performance Policies in Health Care
results.description: In this article, researchers aim to help the public and policy makers understand how a pervasive bias can undermine the results of poorly designed studies of pay-for-performance programs published in even the world's leading medical journals.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Prevalence of Diabetes Among Underserved Populations
results.description: Researchers estimated diabetes prevalence using a cohort developed from the electronic health records of 3 networks of safety net clinics that provide care to underserved populations.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Statewide Comprehensive Smoke-Free Laws and Cigarette Excise Taxes
results.description: Researchers examined state laws related to smoke-free buildings and to cigarette excise taxes from 2000 through 2014 to see how implementation of these laws from 2000 through 2009 differs from implementation in more recent years.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: USDA Snack Policy Implementation
results.description: This study examined snack policy implementation in exemplary high schools to learn best practices for implementation.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: The Healthy Hospital Food Initiative
results.description: In this study, hospitals were recruited to receive nutrition assistance from health department staff with the goal of increasing healthy foods and beverages in New York City Hospitals.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Trends in Early Childhood Obesity
results.description: The purpose of this study was to report trends in prevalence of early childhood obesity and severe obesity in a diverse, metropolitan school district in the southwestern United States and determine whether these trends vary by race/ethnicity, socioeconomic status, and disability status.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Clinical, Economic Burden of Mental Disorders Among Children
results.description: Researchers assessed whether having mental disorders is associated with increased health care costs for children with chronic physical conditions, using Medical Expenditure Panel Survey data from 2008 through 2013.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Health-Related Behaviors for Chronic Disease Prevention
results.description: Only 6 in 100 US adults say they participate in all of 5 key health-related behaviors for preventing chronic disease
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Vape Shop Operators' Perceptions of Risks, Benefits of E-Cigarettes
results.description: This study examined vape shop operators' perceptions of benefits and risk of electronic nicotine delivery systems use.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: The Impact of a US State Alcohol Tax Increase
results.description: Researchers assessed the impact of hypothetical state alcohol tax increases on the cost of alcohol for US adults on the basis of alcohol consumption and sociodemographic characteristics.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Snacking on Television
results.description: Researchers conducted a content analysis on shows that were named as favorites by adolescents to characterize portrayals of snacking on popular television.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Literacy Level of Sickle Cell Patient Education Materials
results.description: The objective of this study was to assess the health literacy level of publicly available patient education materials for people with sickle cell disease.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: School Health Policies and Practices Study
results.description: Researchers examined school demographic and other characteristics to determine their association with the percentage of students who walk or bike to school.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Tobacco Availability, Advertising, and Ownership Changes of Food Stores
results.description: Researchers assessed 12-year trends of tobacco availability, tobacco advertising, and ownership changes in various food stores in Albany, New York.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Multiple Chronic Conditions and Alternative Medicine Use
results.description: The aim of this study was to determine the association between use of complementary and alternative medicine therapies and multiple chronic conditions in a large nationally representative population of US adults.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Adolescent Views of Sugary Beverage Taxes
results.description: Researchers gathered information on adolescent views of how a 20% tax on sugar-sweetened beverages would affect adolescents' consumption of sugar sweetened beverages.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Smoking by Geographic Areas in King County, Washington
results.description: Researchers estimated the prevalence of current smoking among adults at the level of subcounty geographic areas, including census tracts and health reporting areas.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Women's Opinions About Food Access in Rural Illinois
results.description: The objective of this study was to identify resources and solutions to the food access problems of women in rural, southernmost Illinois.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Tobacco Control and Obesity Prevention Initiatives at Retail Outlets
results.description: The objective of this article is to describe the potential for interdisciplinary efforts to transition retailers away from selling and promoting tobacco products and toward creating retail environments that promote healthful eating and active living.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Smoking and Prostate Cancer Mortality in Four US States
results.description: Researchers examined state prostate cancer mortality rates in relation to changes in cigarette smoking.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Cancer Incidence and Mortality Through 2020
results.description: In this video, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention epidemiologist Dr Hannah Weir talks about her work to predict cancer incidence and mortality through 2020.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Effect of Financial Stress on Health
results.description: This study examined the relationships between positive financial behaviors, financial stress, and cost-related nonadherence to health regimens.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Evaluation of CDC's Tips Campaign
results.description: In this study, researchers evaluated phase 2 of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's national tobacco education campaign to encourage quitting, Tips From Former Smokers.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Smoking Among Veterans With Coronary Heart Disease
results.description: According to this study, cigarette smoking is more prevalent among male veterans with coronary heart disease than among their civilian counterparts.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Improvements, Disparities in Elementary School Lunches
results.description: Children consume much of their daily energy intake at school. This study evaluated changes and disparities in school lunch characteristics from 2006-2007 to 2013-2014.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Increasing Community Access to Fruits, Vegetables
results.description: This case study describes the development of the Farm Fresh Market through a community engagement process and presents evaluation results from the project's pilot implementation.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Competitive Beverages in Boston Schools
results.description: Researchers described competitive beverage availability 9 years after the introduction in 2004 of district-wide nutrition standards for competitive beverages sold in Boston Public Schools.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Waterpipe Tobacco Smoking and Susceptibility to Cigarette Smoking
results.description: This study examined the relationship between waterpipe tobacco smoking and susceptibility to cigarette smoking among young adults in the United States.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Health Promotion Through Radio Programming
results.description: The objective of this project was to engage young people in an American Indian community to create locally relevant stories of a fictitious family working to make lifestyle changes and to share the stories with the community through a local radio station.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Barriers to Fruit and Vegetable Consumption
results.description: Researchers find that time constraints influenced the fruit and vegetable consumption of Oakland, California residents.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Diabetes Status and Colorectal Cancer Screenings
results.description: Researchers found that regardless of diabetes status, people who had a routine checkup within the past year were more likely to be up-to-date than people who had not.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Assessment of a University Campus Food Environment
results.description: The objective of this project was to describe the availability, accessibility, and quality of healthful food choices in dining venues and food stores at or near a public, 4-year university in California.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: How Smokers Hear About Quitlines
results.description: In this study researchers aimed to determine how tobacco smoking quitline callers heard about quitline services.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Do Patients Discuss Memory Issues With Their Doctor?
results.description: This study was conducted to determine how many adults reporting subjective memory complaints discussed their memory problems with a health care professional, the factors associated with that action, and the proportion who received treatment.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Pilot Youth Diabetes Prevention Program
results.description: The objective of this study was to compare clinical sites with community sites in the recruitment of teenagers for a new youth diabetes prevention program in East Harlem, New York.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Health Care Among Breast Cancer Survivors
results.description: Researchers find that breast cancer survivors are more likely to engage in cancer screening and less likely to be current smokers than female survivors of other types of cancer or women with no history of cancer.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Cigarette Smoking and Socioeconomic Status
results.description: This study examined the association of food insecurity with smoking and its patterns among socioeconomically disadvantaged young adults.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.

results.title: Re-Engaging Tobacco Quitline Users in Treatment
results.description: Most smoking cessation programs lack strategies to reach relapsed participants and encourage a new quit attempt. In this study, researchers used diverse communication strategies to encourage past quitline users to re-engage in services.
results.sourceCode: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.attribution: Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Please see our system usage guidelines and disclaimer.
